string.text:
Barkeep is the proprietor of the 100 Rads bar in Rostok.
 
Due to Rostok's central location in the busier parts of the Zone, he is a very important trader - a lifeline for stalkers headed to or returning from battle.
 
Aside from the obvious functions of managing the bar - he rents rooms, pays out bribes and supplies stalkers with plenty of equipment and work.
 
He is respected greatly by many stalkers as he was integral to the opening of roads leading to the Zone's center.

Beard is an artifact dealer and bartender aboard the Skadovsk.
 
Arguably the leader of the local loners in Zaton, he is a central figure near the Zone's center.
 
He offers various fields of work to stalkers, though mainly artifact recovery, and is always willing to lend a helping hand.
 
His bar is one of the busiest in the Zone - second only to the 100 Rads - and is effectively synonymous with the Skadovsk.

Ivan Trodnik is the former guide, and now medic of Clear Sky.
 
Once a guide leading his fellow faction members through the unexplored marshes, Ivan now spends his days patching up the wounded.
 
Forced into his position out of necessity rather than by choice, he was Clear Sky's most experienced medic following their near-collapse.
 
Now wishing he had succumb to wounds from his earlier time exploring, his only remaining joys in life are drinking and blaming the mercenary Scar for his troubles.

Nimble is a profiteer who sells smuggled weapons and outfits.
 
Starting out as a member of Clear Sky, and then as a courier for Sidorovich, he has assembled a list of important contacts allowing him to build his own smuggling business.
 
Unlike other traders in the Zone he specialises in the sale of rare equipment, items that can be very difficult to obtain, never knowing what he'll get his hands on next.
 
He originally set up shop at the Skadovsk, in Zaton, but following the resurgence of the Monolith faction has relocated to the Cordon, not far from Sidorovich's bunker.

Sidorovich trades out of an old bunker near the rookie village.
 
He enjoys a reputation of being a fairly honest businessman who gives newcomers a chance to survive, and his wealth of contacts allows him to smuggle in luxury goods.
 
However many also see him as greedy and tight-fisted, those who try to compete with him on his own territory, or just disgruntle him in general, often end up on the wrong side of an assassination contract.
 
Whether for good or bad, he continues to play an integral role within the Zone's economy and its faction's politics, as such he is a great source of work for those wanting to earn a quick payday.
